channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report E-2023100437
item.description:
Report E-2023100437

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-16T18:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AIRCRAFT BELLY DUE TO AN ODOR. UPON INSPECTION DISCOVERED TWO JERRICANS LAYING ON THEIR SIDES LEAKING CONTENTS FROM THEIR CLOSURES. PRODUCT LABELS APPLIED TO THE CONTAINERS INDICATE FLAMMABLE PICTOGRAMS AND A FLASH POINT OF 118.9F. OTHER THAN THE PICTOGRAMS THERE ARE NO ADDITIONAL DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER CONTAINERS. ADDITIONAL LEAKING PACKAGE TRACKING NUMBER 1Z6430970143400719.

item.title: Report E-2023100228
item.description:
Report E-2023100228

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPH experienced a NA1760 Platinum Plus Wheel Cleaner release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 4’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor due to the pail being crushed by improper loading. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged jug and all cleanup debris was then collected into a 15-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100154
item.description:
Report E-2023100154

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During receiving/off-loading at Veolia's facility in Phoenix, AZ Veolia employees observed liquid coming from the bottom a 30 gallon fiber drum that was stacked on top of 55 gallon poly drums. Vials containing liquid COD reagent were packed into a fiber drum with no added absorbent or cushioning material. A 6 mil poly bag containing the vials was used as a liner/inner packaging, but apparently it was not sufficient to stop a release of liquid. The containers were removed from the receiving area and placed into the processing area within facility on a spill containment pallet. Notifications were made to the shipping location with instructions to ship this type of material in poly drums in the future to avoid spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023090638
item.description:
Report X-2023090638

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the unload area wet and starting to corrode. When the package was brought to the QA area for inspection it was discovered that one of the bottles had a loose top and one of the bottles was dented in and leaking from the top. There appeared to be no damage to the package indicating that it was dropped, it may have been compressed during loading and leaked during the shipment process judging from the damage that was happening to the package quickly. DescribePack: The container inside that was dented was leaking from the top due to the weight on the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was turned upright and all the lids were tightened down

item.title: Report X-2023090606
item.description:
Report X-2023090606

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING UNLOAD EXTERIOR PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET. PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A PLASTIC LINED TOTE AND REMOVED FROM AREA DescribePack: PLASTIC CAP CAME OFF BOTTLE AND FOIL SEAL UNDER CAP WAS UNSEALED CAUSING INTERNAL LEAKAGE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE AND CONTENTS PLACED IN PLASTIC LINED TOTE AND REMOVED FROM AREA. TAKEN TO QA FOR INSPECTION

item.title: Report X-2023090605
item.description:
Report X-2023090605

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: PRESCOTT
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered unloading a trailer. Manager was notified. Line was stopped. Trailer was inspected. Hazmat was placed in a lined hazmat tote. Hazmat tote was placed in hazmat cage. DescribePack: 1 container of lime a way had loose cap leaking out of container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in hazmat tote. placed in hazmat cage immediately.

item.title: Report X-2023090588
item.description:
Report X-2023090588

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler informed me of a leaking hazmat. Package was found upside down, open closures and wet. Lid was tightened, contents placed in hazmat bag, then placed in hazmat tote and moved to QA repack area. DescribePack: 3/4 of an inch of seal broken and loose cap on one of three bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap retightened and placed in plastic hazmat bag that closed.
